Sofyan Basir Bebas, ICW: Bentuk Lain dari Pelemahan KPK
04 Nov 2019, 23:12 by M Yusuf Manurung, Martha Warta Silaban
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Peneliti Indonesia Corruption Watch atau ICW Kurnia Ramadhana mengaku kecewa dengan vonis bebas yang diterima Mantan Direktur Utama PT PLN Sofyan Basir dalam kasus suap PLTU Riau-1. Dia menilai, bebasnya Sofyan Basir merupakan bentuk lain dari pelemahan Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK).
"Insitusinya sudah dilemahkan dan saat ini terdakwa-terdakwa kasus korupsi juga diberikan keringanan hukuman atau dalam konteks hari ini (Sofyan Basir) dibebaskan dalam persidangan," kata Kurnia di kantornya pada Senin, 4 November 2019.
Kurnia mengaku heran dengan vonis bebas itu. Padahal, kata dia, nama Sofyan Basir sebelumnya sering disebut dalam beberapa persidangan dengan terdakwa lain dalam kasus suap PLTU Riau-1. Dia meyakini bukti yang dibawa oleh KPK ke persidangan sudah solid.
"Maka kami dorong agar jaksa KPK sesegera mungkin lakukan upaya hukum kasasi ke MA," kata dia.
Kurnia lantas menyoroti keberpihakan lembaga peradilan dalam membantu kinerja KPK akhir-akhir ini. Salah satu contohnya, putusan Mahkamah Agung (MA) yang mengabulkan permohonan peninjauan kembali (PK) terpidana korupsi perizinan Reklamasi Teluk Jakarta M. Sanusi. Hukuman mantan anggota DPRD DKI Jakarta itu dikurangi dari 10 menjadi 7 tahun penjara. Hari ini, ditambah dengan putusan bebas untuk Sofyan Basir oleh Pengadilan Tindak Pidana Korupsi Jakarta.
"Bentuk pelemahan KPK hari ini benar-benar terjadi secara terstruktur dan sistematis," kata Kurnia.
Sebelumnya, Majelis Hakim Pengadilan Tindak Pidana Korupsi Jakarta menyatakan Sofyan tak terbukti membantu mantan Wakil Ketua Komisi Energi DPR Eni Maulani Saragih menerima uang suap dari pengusaha Johannes Budisutrisno Kotjo. Hakim menyatakan Sofyan harus dibebaskan dari segala dakwaan.
"Maka terdakwa harus dibebaskan dari segala dakwaan," kata Ketua Majelis Hakim Hariono saat membacakan amar putusan dalam sidang di Pengadilan Tipikor Jakarta, Senin, 4 November 2019.
Dalam kasus ini, jaksa KPK menuntut Sofyan dihukum 5 tahun penjara dan denda Rp200 juta subsider 3 bulan kurungan. Menurut jaksa, Sofyan terbukti membantu terjadinya suap dalam proyek pembangunan PLTU Riau-1. Mantan Dirut BRI ini memfasilitasi kesepakatan proyek hingga mengetahui adanya pemberian uang.
Adapun transaksi suap tersebut berupa pemberian uang Rp 4,7 miliar kepada mantan Wakil Ketua Komisi VII DPR Eni Maulani Saragih dan mantan Sekretaris Jenderal Partai Golkar, Idrus Marham. Uang tersebut berasal dari pengusaha Johannes Budisutrisno Kotjo, selaku penggarap proyek.
Menurut jaksa, Sofyan Basir memfasilitasi pertemuan antara Eni, Idrus, dan Kotjo selaku pemegang saham Blackgold Natural Resources Limited dengan jajaran direksi PT PLN. Hal itu untuk mempercepat proses kesepakatan proyek Independent Power Producer (IPP) PLTU Riau 1.

ROSSENO AJI
text:
Sofyan Basir Bebas, ICW: Another Form of Weakening of the KPK
04 Nov 2019, 23:12 by M Yusuf Manurung, Martha Warta Silaban
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Indonesian Corruption Watch or ICW researcher Kurnia Ramadhana said she was disappointed with the free sentence received by the Former President Director of PT PLN Sofyan Basir in the Riau-1 PLTU bribery case. He considered, the release of Sofyan Basir was another form of weakening the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK).
"His institution has been weakened and currently defendants in corruption cases have also been given leniency or in the context of today (Sofyan Basir) being released at trial," Kurnia said in his office on Monday, November 4, 2019.
Kurnia claimed to be surprised by the free sentence. In fact, he said, the name Sofyan Basir was previously often mentioned in several trials with other defendants in the Riau-1 PLTU bribery case. He believes the evidence brought by the KPK to court is solid.
"So we encourage the KPK prosecutor to immediately take an appeal to the Supreme Court," he said.
Kurnia then highlighted the partiality of the judiciary in helping the KPK's performance lately. One example is the decision of the Supreme Court (MA) which granted the request for reconsideration (PK) convicted of corruption in the licensing of the Jakarta Bay Reclamation M. Sanusi. The sentence for the former DKI Jakarta DPRD member was reduced from 10 to 7 years in prison. Today, coupled with the acquittal for Sofyan Basir by the Jakarta Corruption Court.
"The weakening of the KPK today is structured and systematic," Kurnia said.
Earlier, the Panel of Judges at the Jakarta Corruption Court said Sofyan had not been proven to help former Deputy Chair of the DPR Energy Commission Eni Maulani Saragih receive bribes from businessman Johannes Budisutrisno Kotjo. The judge stated Sofyan had to be acquitted of all charges.
"Then the defendant must be acquitted of all charges," Chairman of the Panel of Judges Hariono said while reading the verdict in a trial at the Jakarta Corruption Court, Monday, November 4, 2019.
In this case, the KPK prosecutor demanded that Sofyan be sentenced to 5 years in prison and a fine of Rp. 200 million in a 3-month sentence. According to the prosecutor, Sofyan was proven to have helped bribes in the Riau-1 PLTU construction project. This former Managing Director of BRI facilitates project agreements to find out about the provision of money.
The bribery transaction was in the form of giving Rp 4.7 billion to former House of Representatives Commission VII Deputy Eni Maulani Saragih and former Secretary General of the Golkar Party, Idrus Marham. The money came from businessman Johannes Budisutrisno Kotjo, as the project's cultivator.
According to the prosecutor, Sofyan Basir facilitated a meeting between Eni, Idrus, and Kotjo as shareholders of Blackgold Natural Resources Limited and PT PLN's board of directors. This was to accelerate the process of agreement for the Riau Power Plant 1 Independent Power Producer (IPP) project.

ROSSENO AJI
